requirements.description:
The Commonwealth seeks to engage an Advanced Practitioner as the Standard Operating Environment (SOE) Integration Engineer. This proposal seeks to engage an Engineering and Technical Services Advanced Practitioner to assist with the design, development, build and support of LNIC led ICT capabilities used within both fixed and deployed systems.  This RFQTS is for an established vacant position within the Land Network Integration Centre (LNIC).

The position is primarily a technical hands-on role, with responsibility to conduct capability development, as well as design, build, maintenance and configuration control tasks. This is inclusive of capability development and configuration control tasks of software integration and SOE deployment design (including scripting, build automation, application packaging). This position requires a combination of disciplines including technical hands-on communications engineering, innovation, test and evaluation, and documentation.

As a technical subject matter expert within a small team the candidate will also be expected to contribute to the design of LNIC led deployable solutions, data centre and/or network integration solutions, as well as review project design documentation and provide advice on integration across Land Combat System (LCS) interfaces.

It is expected that the majority of services delivered under this contract will be at the LNIC facility in Symonston, ACT. Interstate travel, and possibly international travel, will be required to support TCN trials, liaison with LNBL stakeholders and the support of other ADF field activities. These events will be forecasted by LNIC, booked by the vendor and reimbursed by the Commonwealth.

A three (3) month period of probation is imposed as a condition of engagement for all new contractors.

Invited sellers only

overview.label: Buyer contact

requirements.description:
The successful tenderers will be expected to provide support services to enable establishment of mission engineering in VCDF Group and Defence more broadly. The required services are as follows:

  1. Translate strategic guidance and intelligence into accurate characterisations of missions (mission threads) which reflect assessed context, Defence policies, doctrine and concepts.
  2. Support implementation of mission solutions in collaboration with Capability Managers (CMs) and Delivery Groups (mission engineering threads).
  3. Application of contemporary analytical methods (trade-off analysis, modelling, mission metrics development).
  4. Contribute to the evolution of the mission engineering process into a mature Defence process, integral to force design and capability development.
  5. Support capture and configuration management of mission engineering architecture and detailed design content in a model-based environment.

The contracting approach is based on the following:

  1. Defence requires the provision of up to five full-time and appropriately qualified Key Persons to deliver the services based on ‘Time and Materials’ (T&M) which will be directed and performed under the supervision of an ADF member.
  2. The selected candidates can be drawn from different providers.
  3. The selected candidates will be expected to work from Defence facilities in Canberra.
  4. The contract period is based on an initial contract to end June 2023 followed by the options for two subsequent one year extensions.
  5. The initial requirement is currently for up to five individuals however a merit pool of suitable candidates will be established for additional engagement if required.

EC-2: Demonstrated ability to undertake analysis, apply critical thinking, and innovate on matters related to military and capability planning.
EC-3: Additional experience (beyond EC-1) and qualifications of the Key Persons offered to provide the Services.

jobs.innerText:
Invited sellers only

Comcare
Closing: 26 March 2023, 11:59PM Canberra time
Category: Change and Transformation(+ more)
View details

overview.label: RFQ closing date
overview.value: Sunday, 26 March 2023 • 11:59pm, Canberra time (or once all sellers have responded)

overview.label: Buyer contact
overview.value: No contact details reported. Please direct questions through the 'Question and Answers' portion of the RFQ process.

requirements.description:
Comcare is seeking to develop its future Information and Communications Technology (ICT) Strategy as well as several other key artefacts which directly influence the development of its future ICT environment. Comcare’s current ICT Strategy has been written for the duration of 2019–2023 and is time for a refresh. The current ICT Strategy consists of six workstreams focusing on modernising ICT and the information management processes. Each workstream contributed to delivering key capabilities aligned with Comcare’s current challenges and future priorities including:

  • Stakeholder management— Developing a single view of customer allowing Comcare to better understand its customers and provide better services across the customer base
  • Digital services - Providing a self-service experience so stakeholders can interact with Comcare effectively.
  • Enabled workforce—Using contemporary tools such as robotics, automation and streamlined processes
  • Knowledge— Maximise the value of Comcare’s information by facilitating the knowledge lifecycle
  • Platform— Deliver an agile, adaptive business platform to support Comcare in a dynamic environment without complex ICT infrastructure
  • Cyber security— Ensure Comcare information is appropriately secured against malicious actors

The new ICT Strategy must continue to establish the key ICT platforms and capabilities that will promote innovation, deliver insight, and underpin comprehensive customer-centric services. In addition to this, the new strategies must address Comcare’s highlighted interest in focusing on emerging technologies in the workforce along with increased data expectations, new opportunities for data sharing, current increase in cyber security and investing in technology to maintain a flexible and agile workforce.

requirements.description:
Summary

Reporting to the Branch Manager of Transformation and Project Director the candidate must undertake the following tasks:

  1. Define, plan and direct program/scope throughout life cycle, direct scope change activities and direct program/project stage gates.
  2. Engage and manage a blended team of Business teams, CASA staff and contractors from Information Technology Branch (ITB).
  3. Work effectively and with influence with key business enabling functions to achieve outcomes for the business.
  4. Management of resources, budgets and associated activities to support project activities and deliverables.
  5. Develop project plans and provide detailed status reports on progress and budget;
  6. Work co-operatively and collaboratively with the (ITB) team, as well as other stakeholders within CASA.
  7. Identify program/project quality requirements, conduct quality assurance and manage the quality management process.
  8. Assist in the design and Implementation of risk management strategies in relation to change activities.
  9. Stakeholder, change and communication management.
  10. Other related tasks as requested by the Project Director and Branch Manager Transformation.

Mandatory

  1. Ten or more years of demonstrated Project management experience in business led projects, with complex multi-faceted deliverables across business.
  2. Demonstrated experience in stakeholder and change management.
  3. Highly developed communication (oral and written) skills with the ability to clearly articulate information to influence a wide variety of stakeholders and subject matter experts.
  4. Strong project governance experience, including ability to use tools such as Microsoft Project, with evidence of practical application.
  5. Demonstrated experience in managing diverse and blended teams.
  6. Experience working in or demonstrated understanding of complex regulatory environments, and ability to learn quickly the underpinning legislative framework(s)
  7. Experience with one or more project/program management methodologies (such as PRINCE2, Agile, Scrum and MSP [managing successful programs]).
  8. Effective influencing and negotiation experience and skills in an environment with high competition for resources.
  9. Excellent analytical and execution skills.

 

Location

Based in Aviation House, Phillip, ACT the Resource must work (on average) 8 hours per day (40 hours per week) between the core hours of 8.00am and 5.00pm Monday to Friday.

requirements.description:
The Commonwealth seeks to engage an Advanced Practitioner as the Standard Operating Environment (SOE) Integration Engineer. This proposal seeks to engage an Engineering and Technical Services Advanced Practitioner to assist with the design, development, build and support of LNIC led ICT capabilities used within both fixed and deployed systems.  This RFQTS is for an established vacant position within the Land Network Integration Centre (LNIC).

The position is primarily a technical hands-on role, with responsibility to conduct capability development, as well as design, build, maintenance and configuration control tasks. This is inclusive of capability development and configuration control tasks of software integration and SOE deployment design (including scripting, build automation, application packaging). This position requires a combination of disciplines including technical hands-on communications engineering, innovation, test and evaluation, and documentation.

As a technical subject matter expert within a small team the candidate will also be expected to contribute to the design of LNIC led deployable solutions, data centre and/or network integration solutions, as well as review project design documentation and provide advice on integration across Land Combat System (LCS) interfaces.

It is expected that the majority of services delivered under this contract will be at the LNIC facility in Symonston, ACT. Interstate travel, and possibly international travel, will be required to support TCN trials, liaison with LNBL stakeholders and the support of other ADF field activities. These events will be forecasted by LNIC, booked by the vendor and reimbursed by the Commonwealth.

A three (3) month period of probation is imposed as a condition of engagement for all new contractors.

requirements.description:
The successful tenderers will be expected to provide support services to enable establishment of mission engineering in VCDF Group and Defence more broadly. The required services are as follows:

  1. Translate strategic guidance and intelligence into accurate characterisations of missions (mission threads) which reflect assessed context, Defence policies, doctrine and concepts.
  2. Support implementation of mission solutions in collaboration with Capability Managers (CMs) and Delivery Groups (mission engineering threads).
  3. Application of contemporary analytical methods (trade-off analysis, modelling, mission metrics development).
  4. Contribute to the evolution of the mission engineering process into a mature Defence process, integral to force design and capability development.
  5. Support capture and configuration management of mission engineering architecture and detailed design content in a model-based environment.

The contracting approach is based on the following:

  1. Defence requires the provision of up to five full-time and appropriately qualified Key Persons to deliver the services based on ‘Time and Materials’ (T&M) which will be directed and performed under the supervision of an ADF member.
  2. The selected candidates can be drawn from different providers.
  3. The selected candidates will be expected to work from Defence facilities in Canberra.
  4. The contract period is based on an initial contract to end June 2023 followed by the options for two subsequent one year extensions.
  5. The initial requirement is currently for up to five individuals however a merit pool of suitable candidates will be established for additional engagement if required.

requirements.description:
Comcare is seeking to develop its future Information and Communications Technology (ICT) Strategy as well as several other key artefacts which directly influence the development of its future ICT environment. Comcare’s current ICT Strategy has been written for the duration of 2019–2023 and is time for a refresh. The current ICT Strategy consists of six workstreams focusing on modernising ICT and the information management processes. Each workstream contributed to delivering key capabilities aligned with Comcare’s current challenges and future priorities including:

  • Stakeholder management— Developing a single view of customer allowing Comcare to better understand its customers and provide better services across the customer base
  • Digital services - Providing a self-service experience so stakeholders can interact with Comcare effectively.
  • Enabled workforce—Using contemporary tools such as robotics, automation and streamlined processes
  • Knowledge— Maximise the value of Comcare’s information by facilitating the knowledge lifecycle
  • Platform— Deliver an agile, adaptive business platform to support Comcare in a dynamic environment without complex ICT infrastructure
  • Cyber security— Ensure Comcare information is appropriately secured against malicious actors

The new ICT Strategy must continue to establish the key ICT platforms and capabilities that will promote innovation, deliver insight, and underpin comprehensive customer-centric services. In addition to this, the new strategies must address Comcare’s highlighted interest in focusing on emerging technologies in the workforce along with increased data expectations, new opportunities for data sharing, current increase in cyber security and investing in technology to maintain a flexible and agile workforce.

requirements.description:
The Clean Energy Regulator (CER) requires an appropriately skilled and experienced Business Analyst to undertake an Information Review, help develop the CER’s Information Governance Framework and initiate the Business System Assessments process for the CER.

An information review is a key component of an effective information governance program and will help the Chief Information Governance Officer (CIGO):

  • Conduct an Information Review using the National Archives of Australia’s (NAA’s) recommended approach.
  • Use the outcome of the Information Review to help develop the CER’s Information Governance Framework.
  • Identify the CER’s most valuable information assets.
  • Support enterprise-wide governance for records, information, and data.

Business System Assessment: The NAA’s Business System Assessment Framework provides a consistent, streamlined, risk-based approach to the assessment of information management functionality in business systems. Conducting Business System Assessments on the CER’s information systems (repositories) will enable the CER to better manage its business information through: 

  • Assessing information and data risks and values;
  • Identifying the systems functionality required to manage information and data appropriately;
  • Providing solutions to address gaps in a system's ability to manage information and data; and
  • Ensuring greater accountability and transparency.

requirements.description:
The Royal Australian Navy Central Canteens Board (RANCCB) t/a The Navy's Anchorage, is a Commonwealth Corporate Entity within the Defence portfolio and reports in accordance with the Public Governance, Performance and Accountability Act 2013. RANCCB currently uses Xero as its Financial Management Information System (FMIS) and Employment Hero as its payroll/HR system. Xero has been in use since 1 July 2021 where it replaced Attaché which had been in use since 2018. Employment Hero has bee in use since 2020.

During the 2021-22 audit, the Australian National Audit Office (ANAO) determined that both Xero and employment Hero did not fully comply with the Commonwealth Government IT control and audit requirements, and as such RANCCB received a number of audit findings. RANCCB has decided, in part in response to the audit findings, to replace both Xero and Employment Hero with a fit-for-purpose IT system(s). The request seeks to engage experienced sellers who have capability to provide an ICT Team Lead to support the agency’s Salesforce platform. As an ICT Team Lead, you will be responsible for leading a team of support specialists and managing day-to-day operations of the Salesforce system and the release management process. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify, troubleshoot and resolve Salesforce-related issues and provide continuous improvement to the platform.

  • Manage and co-ordinate the backlog of incidents, bugs, change requests, and system enhancements across the breadth of the Salesforce platform.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize bug fixes, system enhancements and upgrades.
  • Perform operational tasks including access management and provisioning, backup and restore activities, internal reviews, control implementation and service transition activities.
  • Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders to ensure business objectives are met.
  • Monitor and analyse system health and performance, identifying areas of improvement and implementing solutions, including improving the team’s ability to identify and respond to system issues before end users.
  • Develop various reporting including incident and queue management, team capacity and velocity, problem areas, trends, and business uptake.
  • Develop and maintain user documentation and training materials to ensure user adoption and satisfaction.
